entry.et: Middle English Christemasse, from Old English Cristes mæsse, literally, Christ's mass

def.dt: :a Christian feast on December 25 or among some Eastern Orthodox Christians on January 7 that commemorates the birth of Christ and is usually observed as a legal holiday
island (atoll) in the Line Islands; largest atoll in the Pacific area 234 square miles (608 square kilometers), pop 674

entry.et: from its annual blooming around Christmastime

def.dt: :a branching Brazilian cactus (Schlumbergera bridgesii syn. S. buckleyi) having flat jointed stems with scalloped margins and showy usually red, pink, white, violet, or yellow flowers
:a related cactus (Schlumbergera truncata syn. Zygocactus truncatus) or a hybrid of this and the Christmas cactus
:a savings account in which regular deposits are made year-round to provide money for Christmas shopping
:a European evergreen herb (Helleborus niger) of the buttercup family that has usually white flowers produced in winter
:a usually evergreen tree decorated at Christmas
:an oil-well control device consisting of an assembly of fittings placed at the top of the well
island E Indian Ocean 225 miles (360 kilometers) S of W end of Java; administered by Australia area 52 square miles (135 square kilometers), pop 1000
